results.title: Cities in crisis II: a matter of survival
results.creator_credit: Universal Education and Visual Arts and Ray Witlin
results.brief_description: Alarming levels of pollution parallel with urban and industrial growth are being recorded in the metropolitan areas of the United States. Land, air, water and the human ear are victims of this pollution. This film contrasts scenes of rural beauty accompanied by readings from Walt Whitman with the rising accumulations of refuse and decay that threaten the nation’s health.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Universal Education and Visual Arts and Ray Witlin

results.title: Cirque du soleil: Quidam
results.creator_credit: Serpent Films, Cirque du Soleil Images, Rocky Oldham and David Mallet
results.brief_description: Cirque du Soleil’s “Quidam” is an exciting, beautifully choreographed, opulent performance. Recorded live in Amsterdam, this unique circus incorporates acrobatics, music, performance art and theatre. Sung in French with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Serpent Films, Cirque du Soleil Images, Rocky Oldham and David Mallet

results.title: Circus: Serrina becomes an acrobat
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Milan Herzog
results.brief_description: Shows Serrina, aged ten, training to become an acrobat in the circus. Highlights the demands and frustrations in becoming a circus performer. Suitable for middle primary level.

results.title: Circus in Europe
results.brief_description: The arrival of a small circus in a European town, and the parade through the streets. Some of the circus acts are shown, including animal acts and acrobatics. No commentary except for some brief words in German by the circus ringmaster.
results.description: The arrival of a small circus in a European town, and the parade through the streets. Some of the circus acts are shown, including animal acts and acrobatics. No commentary except for some brief words in German by the circus ringmaster.

results.title: Circus at the zoo
results.brief_description: Witty old chimpanzee hosts the audience through a performance by the Chimp Circus. Other chimps ride ponies, unicycles and trapeze and finish with a big band finale.

results.title: Circus
results.creator_credit: Heller Films and New Zealand Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: The story of Zane, a twelve-year-old boy who samples life under the big top when he travels with the family circus in New Zealand during his school holidays. Shows Zane performing tasks in the daily circus routine as well as training and playing with the lion that he has brought up from a cub. The roles played by other members of the circus team are also noted, and a final sequence depicts a circus performance, including Zane’s first time in the ring with Nero, his lion. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Circulatory System [B&W]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
Animation, cinefluorography, drawings, and close-ups of live organs are used in analysing the entire circulatory system. Explains in detail the functions of the heart, lungs, and kidneys; follows the flow of blood through all parts of the body; and explains the role of the circulatory system in maintaining good health.
